title: Bandelier National Monument: Nightwalk
body: Nightwalk         Nightwalks are presented once a week (on Fridays for summer 2016) in July and August, full-moon or not. Photo by Sally King  Nightwalks are special evening interpretive programs offered Friday nights in July and August plus Labor Day weekend (for 2016).  Participants are required to be silent during the one hour walk that allows visitors to step back in time. This walk is not recommended for children or others who can not participate without talking or whispering.  The program is free but reservations are required (call 505-672-3861 x 517 during business hours).
